page.title: 03Walton Windmill
page.content: This windmill was built on{Walton {Hill}in 1741 replacing earlier post_mill types dating back to the 14th century. Local{legend}suggests that the{Duke of Monmouth}stayed at the mill on this site after his defeat at the{Battle of Sedgemoor}in 1685, before his capture and execution in London. This stone built mill originally had a thatched wooden roof revolving to enable the sails to catch the wind . The mill was owned during the 18th century by the Maquis of Bath before falling into dereliction at the beginning of the 20th century. In 1926 the mill was converted into a dwelling by the Rev G.M. Evans and continues in use as a home in 1985.
